generated.title: GeneratedCorrelatedColourTemperature
generated.description: This is an autogenerated partial class definition of 'CorrelatedColourTemperature'

description*.en: Correlated color temperature (CCT) is a measure of light source color appearance defined by the proximity of the light source's chromaticity coordinates to the blackbody locus, as a single number rather than the two required to specify a chromaticity.

title: CorrelatedColourTemperature
description: Correlated color temperature (CCT) is a measure of light source color appearance defined by the proximity of the light source's chromaticity coordinates to the blackbody locus, as a single number rather than the two required to specify a chromaticity.
